description: Borrowed from Middle French piquant (“pricking, stimulating, irritating”), present participle of piquer, possibly from Old French pikier (“to prick, sting, nettle”). Related to pike.

adjectives.description: piquant (comparative more piquant, superlative most piquant)

entries.meaning: (archaic) Causing hurt feelings; scathing, severe. [from 16th c.]
Stimulating to the senses; engaging; charming. [from 17th c.]
Favorably stimulating to the palate; pleasantly spicy; tangy. [from 17th c.]
Producing a burning sensation due to the presence of chilies or similar spices; spicy, hot.
